concept.title: Getting started with Visitor Click Map
concept.shortdesc: Most default implementations already have everything you require to begin using Visitor Click Map.

section.title: How do I begin using Visitor Click Map?
section.p: In order to successfully collect data, the following must be present:

ul.li: s.trackInlineStats must be set to true within your core JavaScript file (s_code.js).

The Page ID (ClickMap) and Object ID (ClickMap) variables must be present within a given image request after you click on at least one link. These variables are also known as the pid and oid variables. Generally, if s.trackInlineStats is set to true, these will automatically populate and can be seen in our DigitalPulse Debugger.

section.p: Once Visitor Click Map is installed, log in with your Adobe Analytics credentials and browse to the page on which you'd like to view the heatmap.

section.title: What are some common best practices and pitfalls to be aware of?

ul.li: Implementing the s_objectID variable on each link will greatly increase your accuracy for Click Map. Sometimes dynamic links or even links in different browsers report to Reports & Analytics differently, and therefore receives a different Object ID.

URLs that appear to be similar may be different according to Adobe Analytics. For example, mysite.com and www.mysite.com can be recorded as different pages in Click Map. Again, using the s_objectID variable is the best way to ensure links are accurately recorded, even across browsers.
